content: This is the place to share the best ways to stay safe while gamblingUnique and practical ideas will be summed up in the list below. As a starter, I will list mine. Best security measuresEnabling 2FADo not buy gambling accounts - by OshosondyOnly use money with a verifiable source - by LuciusPlay in reputable and trusted casinos - by PlaguedeathIf you're worried about KYC, read the casino's terms and conditions before proceeding - by so98nnUse a separate email for gambling - by ZlantannDo not leave large sums of money in casinos - by ZlantannDo not share your login credentials to anyone - by NrcewkerRead the casino's terms and conditions before applying a promotion - by unengComplete KYC before depositing any funds - by goldkingcoinerUse the device that you own and only you operate - by Pandu GeddonBest Responsible Gambling measuresSetting a gambling budgetSetting a loss limitSetting a win limit - by PX-ZOnly gamble what you can afford to lose - by CryptSafeDo not leave large sums of money in casinos(applies to both security and avoiding addiction) - by ZlantannAlways convert bets in crypto to your local currency to understand the value - by edmunddukeStay in a sober state of mind when gambling - by bayu7adiDo not gamble with others' money and loan money - by blockmanGambling should serve as entertainment, not a primary source of income - by irhactNever get greedy - by wiss19And remember - Have fun and gamble responsibly

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: I like 2FA, it adds another layer of protection. There are some gambling sites that do not require KYC, people should know that losing the 2FA backup can lead to loss of their gambling site account that they enable it. But it helps against hackers. Setting stop loss can be good but some people prefer to use gambling budget instead. Once the budget has been spent, they wait until next week before they can continue to gamble.The one that I can add is that no one should buy a gambling account. Some people can buy gambling account if the gambling site they want to register with require KYC and they want to gamble on the gambling site. People should not buy gambling site account.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: I would add one more important thing, which is that you should not gamble with money for which you do not have a valid proof of origin - because I recently read a case where a user won almost $4 million with a deposit of $100k, and now the casino refuses to pay him win because he still hasn't been able to show them where the money he gambled with came from.

comments.author: Distinctin

If there's a legitimate physical casino, it's better to go there or even travel to Las Vegas to gamble. KYC requirements can sometimes be used to exploit gamblers. As they say, casinos love losers but hate winners, especially when large sums of money are involved. I'm sure the gambler was very confident he would be able to withdraw since he deposited $100k, which is a significant amount. However, we don't have control over what a site might do to scam money from gamblers.Regarding the OP, I always use 2FA. I don't see the need for loss or win limits to be automated; I can manage those manually.

comments.author: so98nn
comments.body: Ah, nice topic. I would like to add an indirect security measure that everyone must follow when registering on gambling sites. Now over a couple of months, I am continuously seeing an increased rate of accusations from the user's end where they are not like gambling sites asking for their KYC info because they have reached a certain limit of wagering. However, casinos have everything covered under the ToS. Now, if users do not do any KYC then they are going to lose the funds for nothing. So safety tip: If you are KYC phobic then just read all the terms and conditions of the casino before making any move. If the casino requires KYC then you have to submit the KYC, so make sure you are comfortable sharing your KYC and making your account KYC verified for the safety of your funds. This might look odd, but it's more than a mandatory requirement if you want your funds in your possession otherwise it's gone if no KYC is done after certain wagering.

comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: Quote from: alinknila on September 22, 2023, 03:10:27 PMHave fun and gamble safely Don't also use your main email to register. Getting a unique email that is only used for the casino will be safer. Don't also leave large sums in casinos. Having and following a gambling budget will also be a sound practice to avoid addition or over-gambling. Research on different casinos is also ideal for avoiding losing your funds to fraudulent casinos. Always read and understand the terms of service of the casino. Always check their policy on deposit, withdrawal, and KYC. Also, check if the use of VPN is acceptable if the casino is not accessible from your location.
